page.title: 10Bideford:S+SE.Farm Data Cont
page.content: At every farm a warm welcome was given to the Â£surveyors',partly perhaps be- cause the farms were family farms, which had mostly been in the same fam- ily for generations.Netherdowns a gener -al stock-rearing farm, is farmed with relatives'farms outside the area.West Ashridge has planted 60 of its 87 acres with wheat,for the benefit of its assoc -iated poultry farm,East-the-Water.Ten- nacott includes Gammaton Barton.Pillmo- uth was owned by a previous family for over 70 yrs.A fertiliser dressing of c. 10cwt.to the acre for silage was common ,less if 3 crops were not possible in 1 season.There was some doubt about the safety of growth promoters for beef.All recognised the importance of conservat- ion,though profitability had to come first.Elms have reached young tree sta- ge in places.Dogs and children trespass nr.town(on av.6 sheep per yr., E-the-W)
